content:
• Friday, October 5, 2012
  • OCLR

    Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) -6.8% AH after warning it expects FQ1 (Sep. quarter) revenue of $149M,...

    Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) -6.8% AH after warning it expects FQ1 (Sep. quarter) revenue of $149M, below a $162.2M consensus. Oclaro, which closed its acquisition of Opnext on July 23, blames weak market conditions, a slower-than-expected recovery of share lost thanks to Thai flooding, and a slow ramp of new products, including costlier 40G and 100G parts. Might the Opnext deal also be prompting customers to diversify? Optical component rivals JDSU, FNSR, OPLK, and NPTN could fall in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MWW

    More on Monster Worldwide's (MWW -9.4%) decline: Talks between Monster and a P-E suitor...

    More on Monster Worldwide's (MWW -9.4%) decline: Talks between Monster and a P-E suitor reportedly fell apart, with Monster turning down a $10/share buyout offer. Monster closed at $8.05 yesterday, and $7.30 today. On Monday, the company was reported to be in "advanced talks" with a P-E firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MAR

    Marriott (MAR -1.7%) moves lower after suffering three separate downgrades to Neutral/Hold from...

    Marriott (MAR -1.7%) moves lower after suffering three separate downgrades to Neutral/Hold from Buy at UBS, Lazard and ISI Group (I, II, III). The negative views are based on expected incrementally softer growth for FY13, Q3 below midpoint of guidance, limited upside to Q4 RevPAR +6% estimate, and the stock's 33% gain YTD vs. S&P +16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -13.2%) is in a late day plunge. No news has hit the wires, but it's the...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -13.2%) is in a late day plunge. No news has hit the wires, but it's the kind of move that may mean on-again/off-again talk of the company being purchased is off-again.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +3.7%) moves higher after Benchmark upgraded the shares to Buy and increased...

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +3.7%) moves higher after Benchmark upgraded the shares to Buy and increased its price target to $12 from $10, saying that tire profit margins are starting to show improvement with further gains coming in Q4. The firm adds that its balance sheet is strong, and the company is building cash to pay down and refinance debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (OI +4%) is raised to Buy with a $28 price target (up from $20) at Goldman Sachs,...

    Owens-Illinois (OI +4%) is raised to Buy with a $28 price target (up from $20) at Goldman Sachs, which says the change in capital allocation strategy ushered in by the new CFO will drive OI's' EV/EBITDA multiple back to historical average levels. OI also says it will use 90% of its cash over the next two years for debt reduction vs. a previous focus on M&A.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • URG

    Ur-Energy (URG +9.4%) says the Bureau of Land Management approved a plan of operations for its...

    Ur-Energy (URG +9.4%) says the Bureau of Land Management approved a plan of operations for its Lost Creek uranium in-situ recovery project in Wyoming, the final regulatory step needed to initiate construction and production at the site.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +2.9%) treks higher after Benchmark's James Dobson predicts the company's "importance...

    Zillow (Z +2.9%) treks higher after Benchmark's James Dobson predicts the company's "importance to realtors as a source of leads" will grow in tandem with the adoption of its mobile apps, since individual realtors don't have apps of their own. Dobson, who calls Zillow "the fastest growing real estate information provider," notes the company saw a 125% Y/Y increase in homes viewed/second over mobile in July. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • PIR

    Pier 1 Imports (PIR +5.1%) shares have hit eight-year highs, but Oppenheimer says the retailer's...

    Pier 1 Imports (PIR +5.1%) shares have hit eight-year highs, but Oppenheimer says the retailer's comeback is only just beginning, citing key initiatives such as a recent e-commerce launch. The firm ups its EPS forecasts for this year and next to $1.17 from $1.13 and $1.40 from $1.30, respectively, pointing to expected higher merchandise margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • GRPN

    Down initially in sympathy with Zynga, Groupon (GRPN +9.4%) is now one of the day's tech...

    Down initially in sympathy with Zynga, Groupon (GRPN +9.4%) is now one of the day's tech standouts in spite of having no major news to rally on. This isn't the first time some of the daily deals leader's many shorts have decided to cover (I, II) at week's end.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga's (ZNGA -16.7%) bad day gets worse with news Words With Friends developers Paul and Dave...

    Zynga's (ZNGA -16.7%) bad day gets worse with news Words With Friends developers Paul and Dave Bettner are leaving the company. Words With Friends was a big hit for Zynga last year, but has seen activity decline lately. Resignations have become fashionable these days for Zynga execs and perhaps also developers. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +1.3%) and GE Capital Aviation Services, the commercial aircraft leasing and...

    Boeing (BA +1.3%) and GE Capital Aviation Services, the commercial aircraft leasing and financing wing of General Electric, finalize a $6B deal for 85 737s, comprised of 75 737 MAX 8s and 10 Next-Gen 737-800s. The order also allows for a further 15 737-800s.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA -6.9%) dives after disclosing it will delay filing its FY12 10-K, and...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA -6.9%) dives after disclosing it will delay filing its FY12 10-K, and expects to delay filings its FQ1 (August quarter) 10-Q. Saba, which had already announced a revenue restatement following an accounting review, also says it has expanded the scope of its restatement to cover the impact of the under-recording of billable consulting hours. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -4%) trades lower after United Healthcare's Oxford Policy Update publishes...

    Questcor (QCOR -4%) trades lower after United Healthcare's Oxford Policy Update publishes revised Acthar approval timeframes , which limits the use of QCOR's Acthar Gel.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 18 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -5%) is off again today - shares are now down 32% from their Sep. 12...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -5%) is off again today - shares are now down 32% from their Sep. 12 high. A harsh Reuters column could be partly to blame. In addition to noting the arrival of Starbucks' Verismo, the column points out Wal-Mart and commercial brewer king Bunn are planning to sell new single-serve brewers, and that K-Cup pricing has come under pressure from private-label offerings from Supervalu and Safeway.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 5 Comments
  • IQNT

    Ethernet services firm Neutral Tandem (IQNT -14.1%) plunges to new 52-week lows after disclosing...

    Ethernet services firm Neutral Tandem (IQNT -14.1%) plunges to new 52-week lows after disclosing it's "engaged in ongoing negotiations" with a major customer that could lead to a "significant reduction" in the rates the customer pays, and also require IQNT to pay termination fees for access to the customer's network. The news is easily overshadowing the approval of a $3/share special dividend. Baird has downgraded IQNT to Neutral in response. (new CFO)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • QRVO

    TriQuint (TQNT +6.6%) and (to a lesser extent) Skyworks (SWKS +1.8%) rally after Lazard starts...

    TriQuint (TQNT +6.6%) and (to a lesser extent) Skyworks (SWKS +1.8%) rally after Lazard starts coverage with Buy ratings. TriQuint is receiving a target of $7.20, and Skyworks a target of $30. The RF chipmakers both have power amplifiers designed into the iPhone 5. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • DLTR

    Dollar Tree (DLTR +3.4%) rallies after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse....

    Dollar Tree (DLTR +3.4%) rallies after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse. Rival Family Dollar (FDO +0.4%) has also been upgraded by CS, but isn't quite as fortunate.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • GDI

    Gardner Denver (GDI -1.8%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc, reflecting a more cautious...

    Gardner Denver (GDI -1.8%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc, reflecting a more cautious view of the drilling pump landscape as well as broader slowing in its industrial businesses globally. The firm sees shares as range-bound until GDI works through its CEO transition and management turnover issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • UAL

    In its presentation at the Credit Suisse Global Credit Products Conference, United Continental...

    In its presentation at the Credit Suisse Global Credit Products Conference, United Continental (UAL +1.4%) says it sees its end 2012 available seat miles to be down 0.75% - 1.75% compared to the prior year, and it expects to cut capacity by 1% in 2013 in what would be its third consecutive year of shrinkage. Airlines have been scaling back on flying unprofitable routes lately in an effort to boost their pricing power. (Presentation Slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • FLTX

    After pricing its 7.8M-share IPO at $17, Fleetmatics (NYSE:FLTX) opened at $22.95 and is...

    After pricing its 7.8M-share IPO at $17, Fleetmatics (NYSE:FLTX) opened at $22.95 and is currently moving at $22.47, up 32%. The company, a developer of cloud-based mobile software for tracking and managing commercial vehicle fleets, posted 1H revenue of $58.4M (+37% Y/Y) and a net loss of $366K. Competitors include U.K.-based Teletrac and commercial location tech giant Trimble (NASDAQ:TRMB). (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • IAG

    Iamgold (IAG +1.5%) says an updated mineral resource estimate at its recently acquired Cote gold...

    Iamgold (IAG +1.5%) says an updated mineral resource estimate at its recently acquired Cote gold project in northern Ontario shows a 274% increase in indicated resources, to 131M metric tons averaging 0.84 grams of gold/metric ton for 3.56M oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 (FFIV -3.1%) is slumping after Barclays downgrades shares to Equalweight. But smaller rival...

    F5 (FFIV -3.1%) is slumping after Barclays downgrades shares to Equalweight. But smaller rival Radware (RDWR +2.2%) is trading higher after Oppenheimer says checks indicate the application delivery controller vendor will post above-consensus Q3 results on Oct. 26. The firm claims healthy Asia-Pac demand and improving North American sales will offset soft European sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • WETF

    Wisdom Tree (WETF +9%) gets a pop from a Goldman upgrade to Conviction Buy this morning. The...

    Wisdom Tree (WETF +9%) gets a pop from a Goldman upgrade to Conviction Buy this morning. The firm says the shares have been unduly pressured on rising concerns about ETF price competition, but the company is "insulated, differentiated, and positioned to gain share in an attractive niche." It sees a potential 42% upside for the stock, based on its attractive risk/reward profile, positive AuM growth, and speculative M&A value.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -2.8%) is now a Convinction Sell at Goldman. The firm, which has lowered its...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -2.8%) is now a Convinction Sell at Goldman. The firm, which has lowered its target to a mere $0.60, is worried about Alcatel's future liquidity - the telecom equipment vendor is still hemorrhaging cash, and will see billions in debt mature in the coming years. UBS downgraded Alcatel on Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 9 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW -4.4%) dives on a Bloomberg report that the company, which went public...

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW -4.4%) dives on a Bloomberg report that the company, which went public in July, is preparing a secondary offering. Such an offering would probably be an attempt to give insiders a chance to sell in an orderly fashion ahead of Palo Alto's Jan. 16 lockup expiration.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • PAY

    Payments hardware/software firm VeriFone (PAY +7.1%) pops after Citi returns from a meeting with...

    Payments hardware/software firm VeriFone (PAY +7.1%) pops after Citi returns from a meeting with management arguing sentiment has become too negative. Citi thinks VeriFone, whose shares have been battered by poor European sales and worries about Square's growth, can rebound if execution is solid.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands (STZ +4.3%) posted a mixed FQ2 result this morning, missing on revenue but...

    Constellation Brands (STZ +4.3%) posted a mixed FQ2 result this morning, missing on revenue but easily beats its bottom line consensus. Net profit shrank 23% as results were hurt by higher tax provisions and overhead costs. Despite the mixed overall performance, the better than anticipated margins have prompted the company to raise its FY EPS estimate, now seeing $2.00 to $2.10 per share. Its previous forecast was for $1.93 to $2.03.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • CACH

    Cache (OTC:CACH -20%) takes a hit after saying it's taking a larger Q3 loss than it had...

    Cache (OTC:CACH -20%) takes a hit after saying it's taking a larger Q3 loss than it had previously expected, as its results were hurt by increased promotions and lackluster sales for its early fall offerings. The lifestyle sportswear retailer now expects Q3 sales of about $45.8M, below the Street consensus of $49.2M. Separately, the company also says it's launched a search for a new president and merchandising chief.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • INFA

    An upgrade to Buy from Nomura helps Informatica (INFA +5.2%) rebound a bit from the bloodletting...

    An upgrade to Buy from Nomura helps Informatica (INFA +5.2%) rebound a bit from the bloodletting it saw thanks to its Q3 warning. Nomura argues the risk/reward is favorable, but cautions Informatica's license revenue will likely take several quarters to recover due to sales execution issues. Yesterday, Evercore argued Informatica, which faces strong competition from an IBM that has aggressively expanded its analytics software lineup, appears to be dealing with company-specific problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • CEI

    Lucas Energy (LEI -12.9%) shares are slammed following the addition of two new board members....

    Lucas Energy (LEI -12.9%) shares are slammed following the addition of two new board members. Through their affiliates, Meson Capital and Young Capital, the two additions are LEI's largest shareholders with a combined stake of more than 4M shares representing ~6% of total shares outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • GLUU

    Mobile game developer Glu Mobile (GLUU -6.4%) is one more casualty of Zynga's warning. In...

    Mobile game developer Glu Mobile (GLUU -6.4%) is one more casualty of Zynga's warning. In addition to Zynga's bookings guidance, the company's planned $85M-$95M write-down on the acquisition of Draw Something developer OMGPOP likely isn't going over well.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -7.7%) tumbles after receiving a downgrade to Negative from Positive from...

    First Solar (FSLR -7.7%) tumbles after receiving a downgrade to Negative from Positive from Avian, which claims the junction boxes accompanying First Solar's solar module installations are suffering from reliability issues. Avian, which smartly upgraded First Solar in May, notes the warranty on First Solar's modules lasts for 20 years. Solar stocks in general are selling off (TAN -1.9%) following a critical NYT column about Chinese production. TSL -3.5%. STP -3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • ABR

    Arbor Realty Trust (NYSE:ABR) -5.3% premarket after announcing an offering of 3.5M shares of...

    Arbor Realty Trust (NYSE:ABR) -5.3% premarket after announcing an offering of 3.5M shares of common stock at $5.80/share. The REIT is looking to raise funds to make investments, pay liabilities and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG) -12.4% to $4.60 after taking advantage of the huge run-up seen over the last two...

    Vringo (VRNG) -12.4% to $4.60 after taking advantage of the huge run-up seen over the last two days to announce a 10.3M-share stock offering at a price of $4.35. The offering will take place on Oct. 9, the same day Vringo enters court-ordered settlement talks with Google. The IP holder claims the sale, which will yield gross proceeds of $45M, will leave it in a "position of strength" as the talks commence. (prior offering)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 8 Comments
  • PPP

    Primero Mining (NYSE:PPP) soars 26.1% premarket as it notes Mexico has given its subsidiary...

    Primero Mining (NYSE:PPP) soars 26.1% premarket as it notes Mexico has given its subsidiary there a positive tax ruling on an Advance Pricing Agreement from last October, confirming the company's approach to recording silver revenue and taxes at realized prices rather than spot. The favorable ruling covers fiscal years 2010-2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATHX

    Regenerative-medicine firm Athersys (NASDAQ:ATHX) up 9.2% premarket as Maxim Group raises its...

    Regenerative-medicine firm Athersys (NASDAQ:ATHX) up 9.2% premarket as Maxim Group raises its price target on the biopharma to $6.00 from $3.00. Shares closed yesterday at $1.31.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) -20.4% to $2.24 following its bookings warning, which suggests paying users...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) -20.4% to $2.24 following its bookings warning, which suggests paying users are tiring of its mainstay "Ville" franchises in spite of attempts to keep things fresh. Controversial CEO Mark Pincus, who has seen a huge number of lieutenants depart in recent weeks, followed up by telling employees Zynga is planning "targeted cost reductions" (probably layoffs) and focusing on "strategic priorities" such as mobile and gambling titles.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • PPP

    Premarket gainers: PPP +26%. ATHX +9%.Losers: CTIC -28%. ZNGA -20%. VRNG -14%. ABR -5%.

    Premarket gainers: PPP +26%. ATHX +9%.
    Losers: CTIC -28%. ZNGA -20%. VRNG -14%. ABR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • AVP

    Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) +5.1% premarket on news Executive Chairman Andrea Jung will step down...

    Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) +5.1% premarket on news Executive Chairman Andrea Jung will step down from the Board at year end. Fred Hassan, currently lead independent director and managing director at Warburg Pincus, will succeed Jung next year and assume the position of non-executive Chairman on Jan. 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK) +2.3% premarket after winning a contract valued at up to $8.4B to...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK) +2.3% premarket after winning a contract valued at up to $8.4B to supply small-caliber ammunition to the U.S. Army and continue operating the Lake City ammunition plant in Missouri. The fixed-price contract includes an initial seven-year contract and options for three additional years, the Pentagon says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) +1.5% premarket after Sunoco shareholders on Thursday approved...

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP) +1.5% premarket after Sunoco shareholders on Thursday approved ETP's $5.3B acquisition, creating one of the more diverse U.S. pipeline companies. Sunoco's pipelines have been in high demand recently, thanks to a boom in drilling for gas and oil in U.S. shale rock formations.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • CW

    Curtiss-Wright (NYSE:CW) cuts its Q3 and FY12 earnings guidance to reflect the combined...

    Curtiss-Wright (NYSE:CW) cuts its Q3 and FY12 earnings guidance to reflect the combined impacts of a recent labor strike, additional investments in the AP1000 program, continued delays in the large project oil and gas business, and modest softening in new orders. CW -3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) has its payments revenue target cut at JPMorgan following the Zynga warning...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) has its payments revenue target cut at JPMorgan following the Zynga warning last night. Analysts now project payments revenue of $582M, down from a previous estimate of $797M! Shares -2.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 7 Comments
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) plummets 21% premarket following the pricing of its offering of...

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) plummets 21% premarket following the pricing of its offering of 60K shares of convertible preferred stock. Each share is convertible into about 714 shares of common  stock at a price of $1.40, making a total of approximately 42.9M shares. The current outstanding float is 52.25M shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian and European shares are mostly higher after positive data in the U.S. yesterday and ahead...

    Asian and European shares are mostly higher after positive data in the U.S. yesterday and ahead of the all-important U.S. job numbers. Japan +0.4%, Hong Kong +0.4%, China closed, India -0.7%; EU Stoxx 50 +0.4%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.4%, Frankfurt +0.3%, Madrid +0.3%, Milan +0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 AM
